reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great as mentioned in other reviews. We were asked upon check-in if we wanted to upgrade and we did. Our flight from Boston arrived early morning and we were able to get right in a room by 9:30 that morning. The room on the 5th floor, was large with a balcony, large enough only to stand out on and look out but with a beautiful view of the Opera House, the streets and people below, and the boutique shops as well. It was nice to be able to leave the large windows open all night and get fresh air. It also had plenty of lighting. We did not take our laptops as it was vacation so we did not use the internet.
reviews.title: Architecture like you'd expect in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate dinner that first night at the hotels outside eating area...we opted for sandwiches, they were great ...pricey, but we wanted to stay close that first night as we were tired.
reviews.title: Le Grand was GRAND!

reviews.text: The bathroom was very large, modern, and had room that you could leave out your makeup and such without a problem. I found all amenities to be great. The staff speaks English with no problem and could not have been more helpful.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: I did get a massage at the hotel the first day we arrived....it was wonderful. I had a very nice woman by the name of Pauline who gave a great massage to someone who had just gotten off a cramped flight and been up almost 20 hours.
reviews.title: THIS HOTEL HAS THE ATMOSPHERE OF A CENTRAL TRAIN STATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was everything I could have wanted on my first trip to Paris.....and when I return I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Best location ever
Fantastique
reviews.text: Hotel was wonderful. Had club level suite which was lovely and large. The club level staff were fantastic. I have nothing bad to say about this experience

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, awesome view
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights in November. We loved this hotel, and we cannot wait to go back!

reviews.title: A great hotel at a great price.
reviews.text: We decided to add an extra day in Paris on our return trip from Tblisi, Georgia before returning to the U.S. I used Priceline to bid on a 5* hotel for $240 and got this hotel while other sites had the same room at about $440 for a confirmed reservation. It was a wonderful hotel at the price we paid, but I am not sure that I would have been as happy with it at the higher price. It is close to many of the sights and very close to the sight-sseing bus ticket office. Obviously, it was a whirlwind visit with us not spending much time in the room, but I could not find any fault with the hotel or in the helpfulness of the staff.

reviews.title: This Place was Great
reviews.text: We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Paris. We were there for nine days in February. We initially booked only two nights thinking we might want to move somewhere else. Couldnt find anything nearly as nice for more money.

reviews.title: romantic break
reviews.text: Highly recommend the Le Grand.
Without doubt the two outstanding features of this hotel are the property itself and its location.
reviews.title: A Grand experience

reviews.text: A superb 19th C building with grand public areas and incorporating the atmospheric Cafe de Paix as its dining room. We opted for a deluxe room for the extra space (it also seems to get you a better table in the Cafe). The housekeeping was outstanding - unobtrusive and timely. The location is excellent - 20 min stroll south to the Seine, Louvre, Notre Dame and 10 min north to the great shops of the Bvd Haussman.
reviews.title: C0mme Habitude ; The Finest Grand Palace Hotel In Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Concierge was helpful and accurate on nearby restaurants.
reviews.title: Don't bother staying here

reviews.text: Snags? A few. The hotel straddles a Metro line and the rumble of trains can be heard (faintly) even on the 4th (of 5) floors so light sleepers beware. Breakfast service in the Cafe can be overwhelmed at peak times.
reviews.title: Less Than Grand

reviews.text: If you can put up with the latter, then you should enjoy Le Grand.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Paris

reviews.text: Very nice luxury hotel in the heart of Paris, a bit expensive however the service is outstanding
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel in September 2010 and loved the area. The rooms were very small and a lot of money and not very plush.
reviews.title: Terrible Service with the Porter

reviews.text: We were leaving early in the morning to catch a train to Zurich. We showed the porter and the cab driver our train tickets and they took us to the wrong train station and we missed our train and had to purchase new train tickets. 4 of them.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I called the Corporate Office to complain and all they are going to do for me is send me $40 voucher credit to use at their hotels. What a rip and I will never stay at their hotels. Watch out for the cab drivers and porters when visiting Paris France. There are three train stations.
reviews.title: Smart but overrated

reviews.text: Michelle Isaak
reviews.title: Good hotel but overpriced and overrated
Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: Great location next door to the Opera. We had a beautiful room with a view of the opera. Bathroom was large and had floor to ceiling glass french doors with a great view. It doesn't get much better than taking a bubble bath while taking in the views. We never heard a peep during our stay- even though we were out all night and sleeping all day several times. Impeccable service. Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: This is NOT a 5-Star Hotel!!
reviews.text: Got this as part of a package. We paid over $1900 USD for 3 nights (including roundtrip air within Europe) for two. The twin-bedded rooms are extremely tiny, it felt like one larger bed as they are extremely close together. The room had a balcony which was nice if you can stand staying in it. We complianed and were moved to a huge room with a HUGE bathroom overlooking the interior courtyard. The buffet was very nice for breakfast but somewhat expensive.

reviews.title: Nothing special
reviews.text: The location is fantastique and next to the L'Opera which is a must-see and you CAN tour it! Remember, this is where the Phantom did his Phantoming according to Sir Andrew Lloyd Webber.

reviews.title: This Hotel Ruined Our Trip!
reviews.text: All in all, this hotel is really nothing special and I would definitely recommend staying at another property for this outrageous amount of money! The staff was not really that friendly or accommodating unless you REALLY complain.

If you really do not care about the way the hotel is and just want a decent hotel with clean rooms, this is your spot, BUT if you really are looking for a 5-star hotel experience like I was, LOOK ELSEWHERE!
reviews.title: a true five star hotel

aka: Intercontinental Paris Le Grand Hotel Paris
description: The InterContinental Paris Le Grand, opened during the reign of Napoleon III, is located in the very heart of the city: across the street from the Opéra Garnier, close to some of the best-known Parisian attractions, world-famous department stores and the wonderful Place Vendôme. The hotel contains 470 rooms, all richly decorated in the colours of the Opéra, and a warmly illuminated haven of peace and serenity in the bustle of Parisian life: la Verrière.
